What is the purpose of the <body> tag in HTML?
options: It defines the document's head section.
It contains all the content such as text, images, and links.
It is used to define the main content of an HTML document.
It specifies the body of the email content in HTML.
questions.answer: It contains all the content such as text, images, and links.

questions.question: Which HTML tag is used to create a hyperlink?
Match the HTML attributes with their description.
droppableItems: Specifies the URL for an image
Specifies the destination of a link
Provides alternative text for an image
Specifies extra information about an element

correctMatches.src: Specifies the URL for an image
correctMatches.href: Specifies the destination of a link
correctMatches.alt: Provides alternative text for an image
correctMatches.title: Specifies extra information about an element

questions.question: Which tag is used to display images in HTML?

Drag and drop the correct semantic HTML tag for the following purposes.
droppableItems: Defines the header for a document or section
Defines the footer for a document or section
Contains the site navigation links
Represents a section with related content

correctMatches.<header>: Defines the header for a document or section
correctMatches.<footer>: Defines the footer for a document or section
correctMatches.<article>: Represents a section with related content

tag do?

questions.question: In HTML, what does the `fieldset` tag do?
options: It is used to group related data in a form.
It sets the field to a fixed size.
It automatically validates the fields within a form.
It hides the fields in a form.
questions.answer: It is used to group related data in a form.

draggableItems: Create a CSS file with .css extension

Relative to the font-size of the element

Attributes to improve accessibility

correctMatches.Skip Navigation: Links that allow users to bypass repetitive content

questions.question: Which element is used to provide alternative text for images for screen reader users?
Match the ARIA roles with their descriptions.
droppableItems: Defines site-oriented content, such as a logo or name
Defines a section of navigation links
Defines the main content of a document
Provides information about the content, like a footer

correctMatches.banner: Defines site-oriented content, such as a logo or name
correctMatches.navigation: Defines a section of navigation links
correctMatches.main: Defines the main content of a document
correctMatches.contentinfo: Provides information about the content, like a footer

questions.question: What does ARIA stand for in web development?
Which of the following is not a principle of the WCAG?
Arrange the steps to perform an accessibility audit with Google Lighthouse.
Which of these color contrast ratios defines the minimum WCAG 2.1 Level AA requirement for normal text?
Which of the following elements is inherently focusable, meaning it can receive focus without a 'tabindex' attribute?
Match the WCAG principles with their descriptions.
droppableItems: Information and user interface components must be presentable to users in ways they can perceive
User interface components and navigation must be operable
Information and the operation of user interface must be understandable
Content must be robust enough to be interpreted reliably by a wide variety of user agents

correctMatches.Perceivable: Information and user interface components must be presentable to users in ways they can perceive
correctMatches.Operable: User interface components and navigation must be operable
correctMatches.Understandable: Information and the operation of user interface must be understandable
correctMatches.Robust: Content must be robust enough to be interpreted reliably by a wide variety of user agents

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'lang' attribute in an HTML page?
options: To indicate the language of the page content
questions.answer: To indicate the language of the page content

questions.question: Match the common accessibility issues with their potential solutions.
droppableItems: Add descriptive alt attributes
Increase contrast ratio
Ensure focusable elements and proper tabindex
Use semantic HTML headings in order

correctMatches.Non-keyboard navigable: Ensure focusable elements and proper tabindex
correctMatches.Improper heading structure: Use semantic HTML headings in order

questions.question: Which guideline ensures that content is accessible by keyboard as well as by mouse?
What is the role of 'skip navigation' links in web accessibility?
options: To skip over primary navigation to the main content
To provide shortcuts to different sections of the website
To help users skip unwanted sections like advertisements
To bypass broken links in the navigation
questions.answer: To skip over primary navigation to the main content
